criteria: Accuracy in identifying absolute locations (latitude and longitude)
Clarity in describing relative locations using directional terms and landmarks
Understanding of the relationship between people, places, and environments
descriptions: Student cannot identify absolute locations or uses incorrect coordinates.
Student struggles to identify absolute locations and provides inaccurate coordinates.
Student identifies absolute locations with limited accuracy.
Student accurately identifies most absolute locations with minor errors.
Student consistently identifies absolute locations with precision.
Student expertly identifies absolute locations and explains their significance.
Student cannot describe relative locations or uses vague and unclear language.
Student struggles to describe relative locations and provides confusing descriptions.
Student describes relative locations with limited clarity.
Student clearly describes most relative locations using appropriate terms.
Student consistently describes relative locations with precision and detail.
Student expertly describes relative locations and explains how location influences human activity.
Student shows no understanding of the connections between people, places, and environments.
Student struggles to explain the connections between people, places, and environments.
Student demonstrates a basic understanding of the relationship between people, places, and environments.
Student explains how people, places, and environments interact with some examples.
Student clearly explains the interactions between people, places, and environments with well-developed examples.
Student expertly analyzes the complex relationships between people, places, and environments and provides insightful examples.
